portfolio_tools.portfolio.portfolio module

class portfolio_tools.portfolio.portfolio.Portfolio(json_filepath=None, data_provider=None)[source]

Bases: object

Class to represent and manage an asset portfolio.

__init__(json_filepath=None, data_provider=None)[source]

Initializes the Portfolio class and optionally loads data from a JSON file.

Parameters:

  • json_filepath (str, optional) – Path to the JSON file to load data from.

  • data_provider (DataProvider, optional) – Data provider to obtain historical prices.

Returns:

None

calculate_value()[source]

Calculates the total value of the portfolio over time.

Returns:

List of dates and list of total portfolio values.

Return type:

list, list

calculate_current_quantity(ticker, date)[source]

Calculates the accumulated quantity of an asset in the portfolio up to a specific date. For cash transactions, handles deposits and withdrawals.

Parameters:

  • ticker (str) – The asset symbol.

  • date (datetime) – The cutoff date to calculate the accumulated quantity.

Returns:

Accumulated quantity of the asset up to the specified date.

Return type:

int

plot_composition(group_by='Ticker')[source]
plot_evolution()[source]
plot_evolution_stacked()[source]
plot_evolution_vs_cost()[source]

Plots the evolution of the portfolio value along with the cost of the shares.

plot_evolution_ticker(ticker)[source]
print_current_positions(target_date=None)[source]
print_transactions()[source]

Prints all transactions in CSV format, ordered by date and not grouped by ticker.

print_data_frame()[source]

Prints the portfolio DataFrame in a readable format for debugging purposes.

get_cash_transactions()[source]

Returns transactions for the cash asset (synthetic ticker with __ prefix).

Returns:

List of cash transactions (deposits/withdrawals).

Return type:

list

get_stock_assets()[source]

Returns only the real stock assets (excluding cash transactions).

Returns:

List of stock assets (excluding synthetic cash ticker).

Return type:

list

is_cash_ticker(ticker)[source]

Checks if a ticker is a synthetic cash ticker.

Parameters:

ticker (str) – The ticker to check.

Returns:

True if it’s a cash ticker, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
